fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24232].
  {panel}

We currently use Atlassian's entire suite of products and one of the really nice features in Bamboo are global variables.  You can setup name:value pairs to be used in builds, etc.

In JIRA, we house multiple projects that follow the same release timeline.  Currently, we need to manually keep all of the versions in sync across projects.  There is already a JIRA ticket in place to address that (JRA-2698).

This ticket is nearly identical to the "Global Variables" request in Confluence (CONF-3999).  In our business, we setup a custom dashboard for each version of our software that keys on various filters (Unresolved, All, Released, Priority, etc.).  When we start on a new release, we have to go into each of the dozens of filters and manually change the fixVersion in the query.

If we had a simple way to declare a global variable (e.g. $currentFixVersion), we would no longer need to update all of the filters each time we had a release.
fields.summary: Global Variables

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24223].
  {panel}

Hello Guys,

Configuring issue creation via email, and using the ccWatcher option to add cc's of the email as watchers of the issue, specifically when the issue is created, the users are added as watchers, but they aren't notified of the creation of the issue, if the group to be notified is the watchers group.

I'm not sure it the mail notification is fired before the users are added as watchers, but it's something to look at.

Cheers
Thiago Prisco
Atlassian Support
fields.summary: ccWatcher does not notify users when issue is created

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24222].
  {panel}

Our JIRA is connected to crowd for user ident/authentication. Crowd connects to our AD, where people are identified (login) by a badge number (like g123456).
In the Jira 'view members' page for a given project, if one wants to copy a list of name from one role to another this is not possible.
For example:
 John Doe = g01
 Brad Pitt = g02
 John Ford = g03
If I look at the 'Users' role members, I may have listed 'John Doe, Brad Pitt, John Ford'
But if I copy (ctrl+c) the list and try to add it to another role (say developers), Jira won't autocomplete the names with their badge numbers. (In fact it will do it only for the last name after the last ',') So we have to add users 1 by 1, which is not nice when we have many users to refer to.


(I have created support issue for this, told me to create an issue on jira: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-76789)
fields.summary: Cannot copy a list of user names in 'view project members' roles
Filter tooltip shows the character code

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24213].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 10 April 2012|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hello All,

Many thanks for your feedback on this issue.

After following the thread here and also researching the related support tickets we've identified four main areas that can be broken down into two main paths:

1. Migrating whole directories:
1.1 Internal to Internal with Delegated Auth
1.2 Internal with Delegated Auth to Internal

and 

2. Migrating users from one directory to another:
2.1 Individually
2.2 All users in a directory

We have started working on a fix for 1.1 and 1.2 and we believe this will solve most the of the problems outlined in our research thus far. We hope to finish up this fix in the next few weeks and release it in 5.0.x.

We'll continue to update this issue as more information comes to hand.

Regards,

Roy Krishna
JIRA Product Management
{panel}
\\

Once a user created in 1 directory, there is no way to migrate the user to other directory. For example, migrate the user from Internal Directory to internal directory with LDAP Authentication (LDAP Delegated Authentication).
fields.summary: Not able to migrate user from 1 directory to another directory

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24204].
  {panel}

Hello,

I notice that a lot of users want to know what kind of jira project theý're having on there hands.

What kind of permissions does it have? What kind of notification scheme is being used? Which workflow scheme is it using? Which users have what set of project roles?

Currently there's no way for a user to see this kind of information (at least I can't find anything in jira.atlassian.com, neither in 3.13.5 I am using.).

The only ones who can see this information are jira-(system)-administrators.

It would be great is users could see this information. Currently what happens is one of the following:

- Users come to me and ask me to explain (over and over again)
- I might buy confluence and explain everything in some confluence space/page.
- People are confused about the projects settings and stop to care about them, leaving issues in incorrect states, etc. ("Don't make me think", Steve Krug)

By adding an extra tab to the browse project page could help out a lot!

A nice example of a similar solution, but for workflow conditions is the [Conditions Validator plugin|https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/39261]
fields.summary: Show information about a project's schemes to the user (permission scheme, notification scheme, workflow scheme, etc ...)
Confluence Page Gadget - Login and Approve window not resizing to display the buttons on IE8
Suppress the thousands separator in the excel export
Allow users to select which notification scheme is the default

fields.description: It would be helpful to be able to use JQL to search for versions greater (newer) than a particular version, and to combine that with less (older) than to search for issues covering a range of versions.
fields.summary: Provide the ability to search for a range of versions within JQL
JIRAs ThreadLocalDelegateFactory implementation doesn't clear the JiraAuthenticationContext request cache

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24173].
  {panel}

As a user printing filter results, I want the printed page to be easily readable, so I can have a record of the work at the beginning and end of the sprint for evaluating unplanned work and other issues, and so I can easily share information with non-Jira users.

We recently upgraded from 4.1.1 to 4.3.  During this transition, the filter results have been redesigned. Now, when you choose the "Printable" view, it is pretty near unusable, because of the formatting. (I was using Firefos 3.6.15 or 16)

- Columns are not appropriate widths
- There is no delineation between rows or columns, making it very difficult to read.

I ended up just using the excel version, but that adds extra steps to the process, and we're moving away from Office soon.
fields.summary: Printable view of filter results looks bad

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24171].
  {panel}

It seems currently, _LF_ (or Line Feed) code is used for new line in JIRA's notification e-mail (in text format).

Because of this, on some e-mail clients specifically designed for Windows, the content of e-mail look funny, as _LF_ is not recognized.

* Windows OS uses _CR+LF_ (or Carriage return plus Line Feed) for new line

It would be great if an administrator of JIRA could control which code should be used for the body content of notification e-mails.

We have asked Atlassian support about this but got a reply that probably modifying source code is required, as the vm files for notification mails don't define this part.

Regards,
JP Support
fields.summary: Provide a feature to control new line code used in JIRA's notification e-mail
Avoid replicating entire LDAP/AD identity directories into JIRA local database

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update: 12 July 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hi all,

Thanks for participating in this issue, either by voting, commented or just watching. We highly value your feedback in all forms, and through suggestions in jira.atlassian.com is not different. We use this channel often to learn the best we can with how customers use JIRA and how we can continue to improve the experience for as many users as possible.

We're glad to announce that we shipped a wildcard search for version fields.

Until now version searches supported only exact matches, e.g. {{fixVersion = “9.0”}}

With the wildcard version search it is also possible to search for partial matches. E.g. to find issues fixed in any version starting with “9.”, one can use the search {{fixVersion ~ “9.*”}}

Version fields are:
 * Affected version
 * Fix version
 * Custom fields that use the "Version Picker".

Soon you'll be able to read more about it in the article about Advanced search [here|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/advanced-search-reference-jql-fields/].

Cheers,

Łukasz Jarzembowski

Jira Cloud 
{panel}
With the release of JIRA 4.3, users can now specify a fix or affects version with a wildcard symbol in the Quick Search box (eg ff:4.*). Would be great to have the same functionality in JQL.
fields.summary: JQL - Add wildcard functionality to versions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24150].
  {panel}

A complete description appears in the attached support request.

I would like to access historical remaining estimates via the REST API. It seems most natural to me to add a "timeestimate" field to the "worklog" object, so that every worklog object indicates what the corresponding estimated time remaining was.

Alternatively, a timestamped sequence of remaining estimate objects would work for me.

I intend to use the information to compute the accuracy of every estimate, without treating "original estimates" as a special case.

See also JRA-14538, which is a similar request. My request is specific to the REST API whereas JRA-14538 requests access to the information more generally.
fields.summary: Provide REST API access to historical remaining estimates.
Support HTML5 video in wiki markup in JIRA
JIRA's Profiling and Logging pages should allow you to add new logger configurations on the fly
Changelog of UserCFType

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24135].
  {panel}

In our JBoss Application Server project (https://issues.jboss.org/browse/JBAS) we are well in progress on our seventh major version with several thousand issues historically.  Over this time, components (and their default assignees) have changed substantially from what existed in prior versions, making the list of components increasingly stagnant and useless.  Some degree of separation between major versions is essential yet it would still be nice to be able to apply an issue to more than one major version, while listing the components affected in each major version (which may differ somewhat between major versions).

The only solution we have is to create a new project for every major version, but this has many downsides.

What would work much better is to have a new field "Major Version" which defines a separate category of components and versions.  In other words, each major version ("6.x", "7.x", etc.) would contain a version set ("6.1.0", "6.1.1", etc.) as well as its own set of components.

Please give this issue some consideration - I know that this type of issue has been raised before (in a different form e.g. subcomponents) but hopefully this solution is somewhat more viable.
fields.summary: Special support for "Major Versions"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24133].
  {panel}

JIRA does not currently support connecting to load-balanced AD servers.

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/User+Management+Limitations+and+Recommendations
About half-way down:

"#2) Synchronising between AD servers is not supported. Microsoft Active Directory does not replicate the uSNChanged attribute across instances. For that reason, we do not support connecting to different AD servers for synchronisation."

Many companies have a single DNS entry (mydomain.mycompany.com) that points to a load balancer that directs traffic to one of many directory servers.  (Or, some companies might use DNS round robin.)  However, neither the use of DNS round robin nor use of an actual load balancer is supported by JIRA -- both approaches to load balancing direct traffic to different servers, which would violate limitation #2 above.
Currently, JIRA only supports connecting to a single directory server, not different (load-balanced) servers.
fields.summary: Support load-balanced LDAP/AD servers with JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24132].
  {panel}

Hi Guys,

Hopefully you can help with this issue I have relating to permissions 

Let me just give you a brief background to our system setup, we are using JIRA internationally for UK, FR, DE, AU and SG.  Each country has its own projects so as you can expect the list of projects is very long and quite scary for a normal user

What we want to do is have the projects listed related to the country so only users in FR can see FR Projects, this is obviously very easily accomplished with a group and the browse projects permissions BUT what we want to do is to also allow users to see the project from the other country if they are CC'ed or assigned to any of the bugs

Scenario:

FR bug opened by FR user in FR project
FR project and bug is hidden to UK User
FR user now adds the UK user as a CC
UK user can now see the relevant FR project for the bug they have been CC'ed on

At the moment if you add in "Current Assignee" + "Custom Field (CC)" into the browse permission the user cannot see the bugs themselves (unless they are the assignee or CC) BUT they see the project listed which it shouldn't be

Any way around this?

Thanks in advance,

Joe
fields.summary: Permissions Issue
Simpler user filtering for LDAP Directories

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24127].
  {panel}

Since JIRA 4.3 we have introduced new user management framework there is a chance that during reordering user directories 'random' users may loose their ability to perform task in their system. Or, even login to system.

We should produce a report finding all shadow (duplicated) users across all directories and present them to an administrator who is trying to reorder user directories.

There are correlated issues in the EMBCWD project for eg.

https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/EMBCWD-783
fields.summary: 'Shadow users report' on reordering directiories in User Directories

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24118].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 5 January 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your vote, detailed thoughts and comments on this issue. 
 
Great news. This request is already addressed and our Cloud customers can benefit from it even today. For the JIRA Server customers: the feature will be delivered in the upcoming release of JIRA, which is going to be available really really soon. 
 
With that said, thank you all for for your patience and continued support and voting for this feature request. More enhancements to JIRA are coming soon.
 
Cheers,

Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}

*Original request description*
 
When I have queried for a list of issues, I'd like to be able to use the bulk edit abilities to add a label to some/all of the issues. When adding a label, it overwrites/deletes any existing labels on the issue. Bulk editing of labels should be additive, or even better give an option to be additive or overwrite any existing.
fields.summary: The labels fields should be additive when doing bulk updates
Resolved date is not provided by JIRA REST API

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-24112].
  {panel}

Select and multi select fields width doesn't fits to options text length after upgrade from JIRA 4.0.2 to 4.2.2.
In 4.2.2 the width of fields are fixed on 250px in CSS file, which causes the text to be cut.

Steps to reproduce:

- Create a custom field select list or multi select list.
- Create options with 40 characters or more.
- Link this field to the default issue creation screen.
- Try to create a screen and figure that the text has been cut due to field width.

Check screenshots for further information around css files config provided by firebug.

This behavior appears in all browsers.
fields.summary: Select and Multi Select Fields Width Don't Fit to Options Text Length on Create Issue Screen

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-23941].
  {panel}

when making multiple changes to a ticket within a short interval for example:

1- add a comment
2- add an attachment
3- change status to verified
4- going back and editing my comment
The system sends 4 separate emails?? It should be configurable to allow a time delay from the first change for x minutes and all the changes sent as only one email. I sometimes get even 5-9 emails for the exact same ticket change by the exact same user? I have worked with Seibel and
fields.summary: For multiple changes done to a ticket, multiple emails are sent for each individual change. There should be n minute time window to capture all changes and send one email.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-23937].
  {panel}

As mentioned in the support request:    JSP-75155

I've noticed that if a mail with "high priority" is sent to the jira ticket creation mailbox (Jira standard Create and Comment Handler) a BLOCKER ticket is created. 

I think it would be very useful to have the possibility to activate/deactivate this behaviour via a flag as for the other options, something like autoAssignPriority=false. 

Even if Jira is a general purpose tool one of the main usage remain as a ticketing system for support processes. And one fundamental of any support process is that is not the customer that assign the priority of a ticket but the 1st level. (the customer of course gives information about the priority but he is not the one who decides which ticket is handled first...)

 Regards
fields.summary: Issue Create from mail Handler parameters - make possible to deactivate auto priority assignment when email priority is set to "high"
Ability to disable Log Work entirely but leave Time Tracking on, for use with Tempo

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-23934].
  {panel}

See [CONF-20426].


If JIRA and Confluence are installed on the same machine and on the same context path, then it's impossible to add JIRA gadgets to the Confluence RTE. You can still paste the gadget XML into the wiki markup editor.

What does this mean?

a) Different servers: http://myserver:8080 + http://yourserver:8080
b) Same server, different context path: http://myserver:8080/jira + http://myserver:8081/confluence
c) Same server, same context path: http://myserver:8080 + http://myserver:8081.
Scenario (c) is the problem, (a) and (b) appear to be fine.

This configuration is normal in two cases:

# Any customer following Here Be Dragons (550+ customers to date)
# Anyone using the Inception Installers for JIRA and Confluence on the same box. (most BTF customers from mid-to-late 2011).


h3. What's the customer effect?

JIRA gadgets become useless in Confluence pages without an opaque workaround which will become impossible on the release of Confluence 4.0. For example, it's impossible for a customer to build a release dashboard in Confluence. We've had to yank that functionality from the Dragon's guide today as "please paste this opaque blob of gadget XML into a page" is a shit user experience. 

h3. Solution?

We need a solution that allows customers to deploy Atlassian applications on the same server and still be able to use gadgets.
fields.summary: JIRA gadgets cannot be used in Confluence if both applications are installed on the same server & context path

fields.description:

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-23922].
  {panel}

Steps:
1. Setup JIRA.
2. Create a project and choose "default notification scheme" for it.
3. User forget to add entry for mail server in Admin->mail server.
4. Create an issue. Goto "Admin->Mail Queue". The e-mail notifications are listed there. Flush queue or you can wait for it to go automatically.

Result:
1. There are no entry in "error queue".
2. There is a message in log file which is not very obvious 

{noformat}
"2010-07-16 16:15:26,069 Sending mailitem com.atlassian.jira.mail.IssueMailQueueItem@8667df7[issue=com.atlassian.jira.issue.IssueImpl@454e119d[id=10000,summary=This is a major test,key=TS-1,created=2010-07-16 16:14:47.453,updated=2010-07-16 16:14:47.453,assignee=admin,reporter=veenu],remoteUser=veenu,notificationType=Current_Assignee,eventTypeId=1,templateId=1] WARN admin 975x246x1 1heh7p9 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1%0 /secure/admin/MailQueueAdmin.jspa [atlassian.jira.mail.IssueMailQueueItem] There is no default SMTP Mail server so mail cannot be sent"
{noformat}

Expected:
1. A better error handling....
fields.summary: User can't see any failed notification under "error queue" if there is no mail server configured in JIRA
Components tooltip should show the description of the component, and not the component name itself

I know that the link is the person's name, but that big blue bar is the same colour and as such is *so* tempting to treat as a link, so I always try the bar first.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

SOAP allows only a subset of admin tasks and is not really an alternative.

fields.description: Create a new JQL function that returns the current JIRA project so JQL queries can easily apply to just the user's current project.
fields.summary: Create JQL currentProject() function

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-23885].
  {panel}

If a plug-in which supplies a Workflow condition is removed from JIRA (or disabled in JIRA),
and that condition is currently being used by a Workflow transition,
any step which uses that transition to reach another step will not render any of the possible transitions.

Similarly, if validators or post-functions are missing, no warnings are visible in the UI though the transitions do appear.

No feedback is given to the user that an issue has occurred, but all transitions are absent.

Recommended behavior: 
1) Log an error in the JIRA log (if not done already)
2) Display a warning to the end user to contact their system administrator, and that a "Workflow Configuration Error: A plug-in with a Workflow Transition used by this Workflow is missing from JIRA" with any additional details (name of plug-in, etc) that can be provided.
fields.summary: Workflow Transition Behavior if a Condition, Validator, or Post Function Plug-in Is Missing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-23870].
  {panel}

Studio requires these from the host bundle. Currently we're overriding {{DefaultPackageScannerConfiguration}} to export the following packages:
{noformat}
            "com.thoughtworks.xstream*", // required by applinks used in studio (see r46322 & r46498)
            // required by AGMP --begin--
            "com.sun.xml.internal.bind.v2*",
            "org.apache.xpath*",
            "org.apache.xpath.compiler*",
            "org.xml.sax*",
            "sun.security.util.*",
            "sun.io.*",
            "org.openxri.xml.*",
            "sun.reflect*",
            "com_cenqua_clover*",
            "weblogic*",
            "META-INF.services*",
            "com.yourkit*",
            "com.jprofiler*",
            "org.apache.xerces.*",
            "com.ctc.wstx.stax.*", // required by AGMP (see r49052)
            "com.mindprod.csv*", // required by AGMP (see r50483 & r50554)
            "com.icl.saxon"
            // required by AGMP --end-- {noformat}
Studio's ticket to track the removal of the override is [JST-4072|https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/JST-4072].
fields.summary: Please export the packages required by Studio or provide a way to allow Studio configure extra export packages
Add ability to search for issues that have no issue links (of a given type)
Adding users to project roles is confusing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-23862].
  {panel}

Hello,

Since JRA-21004 we no longer have *automatic* (anonymized) exports of jira data attached when filing a support request from jira.

If we file a support request now, we have to *manually* create a data export and attach it to the support case.

This is all working fine and it's not a problem to create a *manual* export.

However, the data export we create this way (*manually*) is *not* anonymized. We can anonymize it by using: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Anonymising+data?utm_source=support

However, this involves some handwork in a terminal window/command prompt.

My suggestion is to add an option the *manual* data export functionality to be able to anonymize the export. 

Also see: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-74677
fields.summary: Add option to anonymize (manual) Data export
JIRA can't connect to Oracle due to the 'Locale not recognized' error

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-23856].
  {panel}

The trusted apps current application keys are stored in a lazy reference in DefaultCurrentApplicationFactory.  They are not reset by a cache cleared event, and there is no way to refresh the keys without restarting JIRA.  This causes a problem in JIRA Studio where we have often needed to refresh keys.  Use cases as follows:

* Security breach requires resetting of all secrets
* A customers import contains their old keys, which poses security risks to both Atlassian and the customer
* Studio changes the way keys are managed to a shared key between all apps

Since the keys are stored in ApplicationProperties, it is simple for Studio to set/change them, however, those changes won't be picked up until JIRA has restarted.  This request is specifically for a mechanism to clear the cache without restarting JIRA.
fields.summary: No way to refresh trusted apps current application keys
When viewing a filter, only the author has 'subscribe' option on the left
Allow the prefix for cloned issues to be specified from the admin screen (without changing application.properties)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-23836].
  {panel}

Housing an internal blog with wordpress, we wanted to show the latest blog entries on the Jira dashboard. The [wp-igoogle plugin|http://wordpress.org/extend/plugins/wp-igoogle/] provides a gadget for a wordpress installation.

Adding its URL to Jira gadget gallery works, but loading and showing the actual feed content fails because the "makeRequest" returns an error:
{code}
HTTP Status 400 - com.sun.syndication.io.ParsingFeedException: Invalid XML
type Status report
message com.sun.syndication.io.ParsingFeedException: Invalid XML
description The request sent by the client was syntactically incorrect (com.sun.syndication.io.ParsingFeedException: Invalid XML).
Apache Tomcat/6.0.20
{code}

This error message does not help debugging the issue because it lacks important information:
- Which XML is invalid? (URL)
- Where is it invalid? (Line and column)


The Jira URL displaying the error in our case is
https://ourjira/jira/plugins/servlet/gadgets/makeRequest?refresh=3600&url=http%3A%2F%2Fourblog%2Ffeed%2F&httpMethod=GET&headers=&postData=&authz=&st=&contentType=FEED&numEntries=5&getSummaries=true&signOwner=true&signViewer=true&gadget=http%3A%2F%2Fourblog%2Fwp-content%2Fplugins%2Fwp-igoogle%2Figoogle.php%3Ft%3D.xml&container=atlassian&bypassSpecCache=
fields.summary: Better error message for invalid gadgets
Ability to add custom revision to "Source" tab of JIRA issue even if it was omitted from commit message

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-23829].
  {panel}

It would be very useful if there was a custom field type that functioned as a label and/or line break in order to create screens and views that grouped fields together logically.  For example I have an issue type with 15 custom fields, 5 in each in logical category A,B,C.  I would like to group them for user's entering data as:

Category A
field 1
field 2
field 3
field 4
field 5
Category B
field 6
field 7
....

Attached is a screenshot with example shown as 'Custom Header'
fields.summary: Ability to add labels and line breaks to screens (both view and edit)
Suggestions and Autocomplete for Labels is missing in 'Simple Search'
Created vs Resolved Chart in JIRA Gadget needs a means to reincorporate the offset that is nulled at graph t=0. This will ensure that the 'unresolved issues' subplot is accurate.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-23817].
  {panel}

I have an active workflow that I'm modifying in a draft of it (current functionality from JIRA). Everything is great so far and I'm ready to test my draft workflow but my only option is to publish it which will update the live workflow. It does provide an option to backup the current one, which is good, but ususlly is not possible to test workflow on the live system. 

There is a workaround for this but it could be better. Here's my only way to do it so far:
1) Modify the workflow (creating a draft)
2) Copy the draft into a new workflow
3) Create a dummy project to test it

If there are no issues with the workflow is just a matter of publishing the draft. The issue comes if there are problems in the workflow draft and you need to modify it. You have the option of deleting the copy and repeating the above process or modify the copy until you are sattiesfied and carefully make the draft match the copy.

This is probably a feature request or enhancement.
fields.summary: Ability to test draft of workflow before publishing
Documentation for SSL Configurations
Issue update not successful - focus
Make "Sub-task Progress" available to show either in percentage or hours

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-23798].
  {panel}

The slow queries log is a really useful tool, but it could be made a little more useful if the number of results returned was appended to the end of each log entry.

The background for this is that we use the Confluence jiraissues macro heavily, and on occasion someone creates a JQL query that returns far far too many results. Jira doesn't actually choke on the query, but it gets hammered trying to read the DB, convert and then feed the XML results back to Confluence.

I was going to suggest just appending the result size to the end of each of the slow query entries, but I thought there's quite a strong chance that the query itself might not take that long. It's the time taken to feed up the XML results that kill us. So it may be better to log all queries that return great than a set threshold of results (like 10,000 for example)

I think this problem+enhancement applies to all situations where Jira is not paging a result set. So I'm guessing XML, RSS, Excel, Word, Full Content, and Printable views get hit with this kind of issue.
fields.summary: Enhance slow queries log or create a new "large resultset" log to log queries that return above a threshold number of results
In issues list make batch actions available
Add ability to configure a custom renderer in the Activity fields
Resource Planning

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 4 January 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use JIRA so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days; unfortunately we don't have any plans to support this in JIRA for the foreseeable future.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].
 
I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.
 
Regards,
Dave Meyer
dmeyer@atlassian.com
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

From the Administration User Browser screen, have an "Export List" button/link that exports all the users that match the current filter into a .CSV or Excel file. The columns exported would match the columns currently displayed: Username, Email, Full Name, Login Details, Groups. No formatting needed, just dump the text as displayed in each table cell into a single field (including carriage returns for multi line entries like Login Details).

This would be much simpler than having to run queries to do this as described at http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/FYJyCw

The end goal is a simple way to monitor who is logging in most often (need to contact the top 50 users), who has had many recent login failures, who belongs to one group but not another, etc.
fields.summary: Easy User Export

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-23782].
  {panel}

Previous to LDAP integration, we had users such as john, sam, bob, phil, melissa, linda, etc. Now that we have implemented LDAP integration our naming convention is <first initial of first name>-<last name>, (jsmith, ssmith, bwilson, pbears), so the users who have local jira accounts can't utilize their LDAP accounts without starting from scratch. 

Can there be a process developed where we can migrate (user: linda, account:local)'s data to (user:lsmith, account:ldap)?

Users would really like to use one password for all sites (without having to set it to be the same in JIRA) and have that password sync with LDAP. This works great for new users who are using the accounts integrated w/ LDAP, but old users cannot do this :(

Help!
fields.summary: Create migration process for local users to have data migrated over to LDAP account

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-23777].
  {panel}

After creating a user via SOAP, JIRA will send out a notification to the created user email. But the email notification contains incomplete information whereby the information on the user responsible for the action is null. Below is the example of the notification sent:
{quote}
A JIRA account has been created for you at:

http://localhost:8080

This is either because an administrator has created an account for you,
or because you have been assigned to an issue.

You can change your password here:

http://localhost:8080/secure/ViewProfile.jspa

Here are the details of your account:
---------------------------------------------------------------------
Username: soapuser
Email: email@live.com.my
Full Name: soapuser
Password: soapuser
(If you forget your password, you can retrieve it via the "Forgot Password" link on the sign up page)
*This action was initiated by null (null).*

-- 
This message is automatically generated by JIRA.
-
If you think it was sent incorrectly contact one of the administrators: http://localhost:8080/secure/Administrators.jspa
{quote}

Steps to reproduce the bug:
# Run JIRA with _Accept remote API calls_ turned on
# Run a SOAP client with createUser() method to create a new user
# User is created, notification is sent

Tested in JIRA 4.0.1, 4.1.2, 4.2.1, the bug occurs in all the mentioned version.
fields.summary: Email notification contains the message '_This action was initiated by null (null)_' when creating a user via SOAP

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

Ehcache 1.7.0+ will periodically phone home and emit a log message if there is a newer version available. This isn't a useful check when ehcache is shipped as a library in another product.

Quartz does similar.

Even if you aren't shipping 1.7.0+ (yet), you might as well add the check now.

JIRA (at least 4.3) has a transient dependency on ehcache.
fields.summary: Disable ehcache and quartz phone-home timers.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-23720].
  {panel}

Plugins (such as the commit acceptance plugin), when converted to v2 plugins, have their i18n break if they use the "magic".

The "magic" is that they have an action class Foo which extends JiraWebActionSupport, and a Foo.properties file right next to the class file in their jar with i18n keys, and no mention of it in code or plugin descriptor.  This method of i18n "just works" for v1 plugins but breaks when you make them v2 plugins.

When that happens, the following shows up in the logs for every key referenced:
{noformat}
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 2011-02-16 21:52:23,785 http-2990-2 DEBUG admin 352x273x1 1wxv13h 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/CommitAcceptanceConfigure.jspa [commitacceptance.server.action.ConfigureAction] Cannot find key 'commitacceptance.prompt.unsavedConfig'
{noformat}

You can reproduce this using the commit acceptance plugin source located here:
http://svn.atlassian.com/svn/public/contrib/jira/jira-commitacceptance-plugin/trunk

By applying the following patch:
{noformat}
diff --git a/src/main/resources/atlassian-plugin.xml b/src/main/resources/atlassian-plugin.xml
index eeefc70..d8bed9d 100644
--- a/src/main/resources/atlassian-plugin.xml
+++ b/src/main/resources/atlassian-plugin.xml
@@ -1,4 +1,4 @@
-<atlassian-plugin key="${project.groupId}.${project.artifactId}" name="${project.name}">
+<atlassian-plugin key="${project.groupId}.${project.artifactId}" name="${project.name}" plugins-version="2">
{noformat}

mrdon in #atlassiandev on freenode has confirmed that this should be a bug.

Thanks!
fields.summary: webwork1 "magic" for i18n is broken for v2 plugins

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-23718].
  {panel}

Hi, some of our users have a large number of search filters (125+).  This can make life very difficult for them, when they try to Manage Filters (Issues > Manage Filters).  A given filter may only take a few seconds to update, but with so many filters the page overall can take 6-8 minutes to refresh.  

If the user is trying to work just a few filters, for example to share with other users, then they still have to take the performance hit for the whole list, despite only being focused on a few filters.

We would like to request that the Manage Filters page be paginated, and show only a few filters (or a configurable bound) per page.  Or allow a user to configure which sub-set of filters is actively visible.  

Note that the key feature is that the page needs to show the filter and the number of matches for the filter.  We did try and use:

https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/wiki/display/JOUT/Filter+List+Plugin

But it does not meet this key requirement, and its buggy/difficult to use :( 

However if pagination can be added to the Manage Filters page, it should resolve the resolve the performance issue in a reasonable way.
fields.summary: Filter Management Should be Paginated

Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and what you're hoping to accomplish with JIRA.

At this time, this suggestion is not on the JIRA development roadmap. Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

Dave Meyer
[dmeyer@atlassian.com|mailto:dmeyer@atlassian.com]
Product Manager, JIRA Platform

The suggestions for labels should be scoped by labels used in a given project.  Or perhaps limited to a project or group specific list.

When multiple teams are using JIRA, they have different conventions for labels for their issues.  By using a single namespace for the suggestions, the teams are presented with potentially ambiguous or misleading suggestions.
fields.summary: Labels suggestion should be scoped by project

# Link an issue with another.
# Under the Activity area, click All.
# In a _Link_ field, the *New Value* shows the linked project key twice.

!Activity Section After Issue Link.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-23631].
  {panel}

At present, if you wish to display links in filter results, you've got one option for your column - Issue Links.
This is useful to a point. You can see all of the related issues and whether they are resolved or not.
However, you cannot see the relationship between the linked issues.

It would be really useful if you could select a relationship from the issue navigator column selection.
This would allow you to break out single relationships into individual columns.
fields.summary: Allow selection of individual relationships as columns in issue navigator
